title: 110_s2476
content: The "Improved Vaccine Supply Act" is cited as the short title. It amends the Public Health Service Act to include a new section on adequate vaccine supply. The "Improved Vaccine Supply Act" mandates the development of a plan for purchasing, storing, and rotating a supply of vaccines for children and adults, including those recommended by the Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices and other vaccines designated by the Secretary to contribute to public health. The Secretary is required to develop a plan for purchasing, storing, and rotating vaccines for children and adults as recommended by the Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices. The plan must be submitted to specific Senate committees within 6 months of enactment. The Secretary must develop a plan for purchasing vaccines and submit it to specific Senate committees. The plan should include considerations for the basis and schedule of vaccine purchases. By September 30, 2008, the plan must be fully implemented. Additionally, the Secretary must be notified at least 1 year in advance of any vaccine discontinuation by the manufacturer to maintain vaccine supply. The Secretary must be notified at least 1 year in advance of any vaccine discontinuation by the manufacturer to maintain vaccine supply. Any proceeds from vaccine sales will be used to purchase additional vaccines for the supply. Ongoing reports must be submitted periodically after the plan is implemented. The Secretary must be notified in advance of any vaccine discontinuation by the manufacturer to maintain supply. Proceeds from vaccine sales will be used to purchase additional vaccines. Ongoing reports detailing progress and impediments in plan implementation will be submitted periodically. Authorization of appropriations is provided for this purpose. Authorization of appropriations is provided for fiscal years 2008 through 2012 to carry out the recommendations made regarding vaccine supply.
